text: Alyxia taiwanensis is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae, that is endemic to Taiwan. It is threatened by habitat loss. It grows orange berries and eye shaped, leather-like leaves. The leaves grow in whorls of 3-7 opposite to each other on long twirling vines. Seeds begin forming in approximately 1 month, germinating in just over 4 months. ==References== taiwanensis Category:Flora of Taiwan Category:Endemic flora of Taiwan Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Alyxia taiwanensis
